I. 1.</br>Boldly smite the votive lyre,</br>And let our joy our hearts inspire:</br>The Fates unfold a fairer scroll;</br>And happier years begin to roll.</br>High-mounted on his fiery car,</br>Retreats the fierce-ey'd God of War:</br>Alarms, and Fears, and pale Dismay,</br>And black-brow'd Horror mark his way;</br>With Carnage foul, and wild Despair;</br>And dread Confusion through the rear.

I. 2.</br>Now let joy expand the soul,</br>Happier years begin to roll.</br>From Heav'n the gracious mandate past,</br>And PEACE bids warring nations rest.</br>Say, lovely Maid, what pathless grot,</br>From wild Ambition's rage remote;</br>What lone retreat your steps detain'd,</br>While War and madding Discord reign'd?</br>Where Oroonoko's rapid wave</br>Does th' unfrequented valley lave,</br>With th' artless Indian didst thou rove</br>The orange-glade, or citron-grove;</br>Where Europe's crimes shall ne'er invade,</br>To taint with gore the placid shade?

I. 3.</br>Ambition's flaming bolts were hurl'd;</br>And Terror shook th' astonish'd world;</br>Mad Rapine rag'd with threefold wrath,</br>And rous'd the frantic scream of Death.</br>PEACE came; — her radiant form display'd,</br>The blood-stain'd monsters saw, and fled.</br>Impervious clouds involve the midnight sky,</br>And now ferment, now roar aloud;</br>The glaring lightnings flash abroad;</br>And black-wing'd Tempests rule, and rage on high.</br>How soon the crystal gates of day</br>Expand to Phoebus' glowing car,</br>The storms retire, the shades decay,</br>And balmy breezes skim the air:</br>The shepherd swain attunes his Doric lay,</br>And wildly-warbling, hymns the rise of day.

II. 1.</br>Now restor'd from dread alarms,</br>And the direful pomp of arms,</br>The warrior, crown'd with lasting bays,</br>Enjoys the blissful calm of ease.</br>Warm Friendship crowns the rosy bowl;</br>And social pleasure melts his soul;</br>And young Love waves his turtle wing;</br>While Music smites the trembling string,</br>And laughter-loving maids advance,</br>To mingle in the mazy dance.

II. 2.</br>Genial PEACE, to thee belong</br>Mirth, and dance, and jocund song!</br>From haunted groves, and vocal glades,</br>And Helicon's inspiring shades,</br>Ye Nine, unite the choral song;</br>In festive measure move along;</br>And frame the gratulating lay:</br>To PEACE, the grateful tribute pay.—</br>Hail, Goddess of the brow serene!</br>Belov'd of thee the tuneful strain:</br>For in the lucid climes above,</br>Reside the radiant throne of Jove,</br>No higher bliss thy bosom knows</br>Than heavenly Harmony bestows.

II. 3.</br>Reviv'd by thy propitious aid,</br>Fair Science lifts her modest head;</br>With all her various offspring join'd,</br>To pour new favours on mankind.</br>As foster'd by the vernal showers,</br>Up spring the many-tinctur'd flowers:</br>In loveliest raiment smiles th' Arcadian vale;</br>Here vermil blushes paint the rose,</br>And there the snowy lily blows;</br>And choicest sweets perfume the vagrant gale,</br>Long may the golden periods run!</br>Long, Goddess, to the sons of men,</br>Be all thy tranquil pleasures known;</br>While Discord bites the galling chain,</br>And direful Tart'rus, from its utmost bounds,</br>The hideous howling of his wo resounds.</br>
